"المتابعة العربية" تناقش آليات التصدي لمخطط الكرفانات في النقب

02 Nov 2019, 18:56

الناصرة - سوا
عقدت لجنة المتابعة العليا للجماهير العربية، اليوم السبت، اجتماعا لمناقشة التصدي لمخطط الكرفانات، الذي يشكل تهديدا على العرب في النقب ويسعى إلى تهجيرهم ومصادرة أراضيهم.
ويهدف المخطط لخلق مخيمات لجوء وأحياء فقر لعرب النقب، وإلغاء دعاوى الملكيّة العربية في المحاكم الإسرائيلية، وتهجير العرب، وتظهر خطورة مخطط "الكرفانات -مخيمات اللاجئين لعرب النقب أبعاده الأكثر كارثية على النقب منذ مخطط "برافر" الّذي سقط عام 2013.
وأتى ذلك، خلال الاجتماع الذي عقد في قرية حورة في النقب بمشاركة العديد من القيادات ورؤساء السلطات المحلية العربية ونواب عن القائمة المشتركة، كما حضر الاجتماع أعضاء لجنة التوجيه في النقب ومندوبين عن القرى مسلوبة الاعتراف وبتمثيل من مؤسسة عدالة. بحسب "عرب 48".
وتم بحث سبل مواجهة قضايا العنف والجريمة في المجتمع العربي، ومخطط التهجير الجديد لعرب النقب والذي تنوي الحكومة الإسرائيلية تنفيذه بحق عشرات الآلاف من العرب في النقب.
وقال النائب وليد طه "من الواضح أن حكومة إسرائيل تنوي تطبيق مخطط "برافر" السابق من خلال مخطط جديد هدفه سلب ومصادرة ما يقارب الـ400 ألف دونم من الأراضي العربية وتهجير عشرات الآلاف من عرب النقب.
وأكدت المتابعة أن الجماهير العربية في النقب وفي كل البلاد ولجنة المتابعة ولجنة التوجيه والقائمة المشتركة ورؤساء القرى والمدن في النقب، سيتصدون لهذا المشروع التهجيري الجديد بكل الوسائل لإفشاله وثني الحكومة عن الاستمرار به.
مخطط "الكرفانات" الجديد هو استمرار لسياسة اقتلاع أصحاب الأرض العرب من أراضيهم، علما أن إسرائيل أحكمت سيطرتها من خلال سياسات التهجير والملاحقة والمصادرة على أكثر من 95% من أراضي العرب في النقب، في حين أن كل عرب النقب اليوم يعيشون على مساحة لا تزيد عن 3% فقط من أراضيهم الأصلية.
ويقضي المخطط بتهجير قرابة 36 ألف عربي من قراهم، مقسمة ضمن ثلاثة مخططات، تقضي الأولى بتهجير حيز 6 قرى ثابتة، هي مخطّط شرقي النّقب، اللقية، كسيفة، حورة، تل السبع، شقيب السلام، وعرعرة النقب، فيما يضمّ المخطّط الثاني المجلسين الإقليميين واحة الصحراء والقيصوم، تحت ما يسمى بمخطط "أبو بسمة"، يضاف إلى هذين المخططين مخطط ثالث هو مخطط حي "بير الحمام".

Haris Theocharis: We are looking forward to higher revenue from Tourism

02 Nov 2019, 18:05


Interview with Vicky Kurlimbin at Capital.gr


In view of London's major international travel market exhibition "World Travel Market", Tourism Minister Haris Theocharis speaks to Capital.gr about the challenges of the season following the collapse of Thomas Cook, changes to the short-term lease table and the end of the stay, the incentives for new investments, but also the target of 10% higher revenue from Tourism in 2020.

All this in the light of a business shift towards higher quality tourism services, the attraction of higher income visitors and the overall upgrading of the product offered, with the development of a long-term development plan.

After the collapse of Thomas Cook and the losses in both this year and next tourist season, what are the next measures to limit the damage?

The extent to which the closure of Thomas Cook in the 2020 season will affect us is now known. About half a billion euros are the cost of contracts that will not be implemented. But to be clear, this amount is not an actual loss, but a potential loss for which we have the tools to mitigate it.
We need to work with the airlines to fill the 1.6 million lost seats. Keep in touch with tour operators for contractors with hoteliers. At the same time we have taken measures to support the tourism businesses affected. And from now on, with a more aggressive display campaign we will be able to recover lost ground.
The good news is that the fall of Thomas Cook does not damage our country's image as a destination and tourists' contact with Greece has remained unchanged.

The London international fair, which begins on November 4, will give you a first glimpse of how bookings for travel packages will evolve next year, as the Brexit issue may shed new light. What are the goals of the Ministry of Tourism?

Obviously we need to think through what Brexit means. I personally believe that the messages we receive in London will not be negative, but that remains to be proved.
We still have no picture of bookings from the UK, as package sales are starting this season. But at "World Travel Market" we get a first taste and have a strong presence. The international exhibition is the barometer of how the next season will begin.

Eventually the "basket" of revenue from Tourism will be 500 million euros higher this year, as you estimated? And what is the next bet on tourist sizes?

The good weather of October has helped to keep the tourist traffic and revenue positive, offsetting the losses from the cancellation of Thomas Cook's packages. I believe that revenue will be higher at this level than last year.
Our target for 2020 will be to stabilize tourist sizes, perhaps with a slight increase in the number of foreign visitors. For the receipts, we expect an increase of about 10% compared to this year.
So it is important to start focusing now on the qualitative part of Tourism, not the quantitative one. We have begun the processes for a long-term tourism development plan and are already talking with the Hellenic Tourism Business Association and the Hellenic Chamber of Hotels to implement the implementation plan. We will have a lot more to say in the coming months.

As for the accommodation fee, what are the scenarios you are working on?

It is clear that changes in the end of the stay should be made in line with the Treasury's financial margins.
On the other hand, the residence fee has an over-performance compared to the original forecasts. We will explore the possibilities we have so that the end will directly support Greek Tourism. In my opinion, it should have a degree of reciprocity.
With regard to taxation of the tourist product, I would like to point out that it is related to its competitiveness. We have tabled our proposals to reduce the taxation of the package to the Treasury and await the final plan.

What can property owners expect for short-term leases?

For us Tourism without the sharing economy can no longer be understood and is part of the tourism product. We will not, however, follow the logic of the old regime adopted by the previous Government. We will submit our proposals to the Prime Minister for final government decisions.

Investment interest in the domestic tourism market remains high. Will you give more incentives to new investors?

As part of our draft law on diving tourism, we have put together all the proposals for improving the existing institutional framework. One example is to enable, if the investment is to upgrade energy infrastructure, an increase in the building coefficient for public spaces. It is certain that private initiative has matured and sustainability has been at the heart of investment.
